intro: Torilis elata, commonly known as slender burrweed, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that appear in umbrella-like clusters. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a slightly hairy texture. Torilis elata is typically found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and meadows.
